keyTakeAways: Josh Shapiro, the governor of Pennsylvania, is publishing a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service,' set for release on January 27, 2025.
The book details Shapiro’s political rise, personal experiences, faith, and family life, including the traumatic arson attack on his home in April 2024.

Shapiro was elected governor in 2022 and has become a prominent national Democrat, with mentions on Kamala Harris’ shortlist for vice presidential running mate and potential 2028 presidential candidacy.
The arson incident involved Cody Balmer, who pleaded guilty to charges of arson and attempted murder and was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison.
HarperCollins Publishers, through its Harper imprint, announced the book release, highlighting Shapiro’s personal and public service journey as a central theme.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania is set to release a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025, which chronicles his political rise, personal struggles, and the trauma of a home fire in April 2024. The incident, in which a man named Cody Balmer set fire to the governor’s mansion during a Passover gathering, led to a plea deal with a sentence of 25 to 50 years in prison. Shapiro, who was elected governor in 2022 and has been recognized as a potential vice presidential running mate under Kamala Harris and a possible 2028 presidential candidate, shares stories of faith, family, and public service in the book. The memoir, published by HarperCollins, reflects on his journey of resilience, community service, and personal growth, offering a personal narrative that resonates with broader national conversations on leadership and trauma.
title: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to Release Memoir on Trauma and Service in January
